text: What patterns about factors, multiples, products, and quotients, help you play the Integer Product Game?

Answers will vary. Possible answers:

  • You can make a negative product by choosing either one of the factors to be negative. You can make a positive product by choosing both of the factors to be positive or by choosing both of the factors to be negative.
  • Some of the products on the board have more possible factor pairs. For example, you can make 30 by choosing 1*30, (-1)*(-30), 2*15, (-2)*(-15), 3*10, (-3)*(-10), 5*6, or (-5)*(-6). It is more common for products with a greater absolute value to have more possible factor pairs.
  • There is no way to make a product of 1 on this board.
